distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
Updated wireshark packages that fix several security issues are now
available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4 and 5.

This update has been rated as having moderate security impact by the Red
Hat Security Response Team.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Wireshark is a program for monitoring network traffic. Wireshark was
previously known as Ethereal.

Several flaws were found in Wireshark. Wireshark could crash or possibly
execute arbitrary code as the user running Wireshark if it read a malformed
packet off the network. (CVE-2007-6112, CVE-2007-6114, CVE-2007-6115,
CVE-2007-6117)

Several denial of service bugs were found in Wireshark. Wireshark could
crash or stop responding if it read a malformed packet off the network.
(CVE-2007-6111, CVE-2007-6113, CVE-2007-6116, CVE-2007-6118, CVE-2007-6119,
CVE-2007-6120, CVE-2007-6121, CVE-2007-6438, CVE-2007-6439, CVE-2007-6441,
CVE-2007-6450, CVE-2007-6451)

As well, Wireshark switched from using net-snmp to libsmi, which is
included in this errata.

Users of wireshark should upgrade to these updated packages, which contain
Wireshark version 0.99.7, and resolve these issues.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Wireshark (formerly Ethereal) allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via (1) a crafted MP3 file or (2) unspecified vectors to the NCP dissector.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2007-6111 wireshark mp3 and ncp flaws
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released
errata relevant to your system have been applied.  

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use 
the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/FAQ_58_10188

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2007-6111 wireshark mp3 and ncp flaws

notes.text: Buffer overflow in the PPP dissector Wireshark (formerly Ethereal) 0.99.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2007-6112 wireshark ppp flaws
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released
errata relevant to your system have been applied.  

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use 
the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/FAQ_58_10188

notes.text: Integer signedness error in the DNP3 dissector in Wireshark (formerly Ethereal) 0.10.12 to 0.99.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (long loop) via a malformed DNP3 packet.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2007-6113 wireshark DNP3 flaws
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat is aware of this issue and is tracking it via the following bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2007-6113

The Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having low security impact, a future update may address this flaw.
notes.title: Statement

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released
errata relevant to your system have been applied.  

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use 
the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/FAQ_58_10188

notes.text: Multiple buffer overflows in Wireshark (formerly Ethereal) 0.99.0 through 0.99.6 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via (1) the SSL dissector or (2) the iSeries (OS/400) Communication trace file parser.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2007-6114 wireshark SSL and OS/400 trace flaws
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2007-6114 wireshark SSL and OS/400 trace flaws

notes.text: Buffer overflow in the ANSI MAP dissector for Wireshark (formerly Ethereal) 0.99.5 to 0.99.6, when running on unspecified platforms, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2007-6115 wireshark ANSI MAP flaws
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The Firebird/Interbase dissector in Wireshark (formerly Ethereal) 0.99.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop or crash) via unknown vectors.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2007-6116 wireshark firebird/interbase flaws
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Unspecified vulnerability in the HTTP dissector for Wireshark (formerly Ethereal) 0.10.14 to 0.99.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via crafted chunked messages.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2007-6117 wireshark HTTP dissector flaws
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Unspecified vulnerability in the SMB dissector in Wireshark (formerly Ethereal) 0.99.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via unknown vectors. NOTE: this identifier originally included MP3 and NCP, but those issues are already covered by CVE-2007-6111.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2007-6438 wireshark SMB dissector crash

notes.text: Wireshark (formerly Ethereal) 0.99.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite or large loop) via the (1) IPv6 or (2) USB dissector, which can trigger resource consumption or a crash. NOTE: this identifier originally included Firebird/Interbase, but it is already covered by CVE-2007-6116. The DCP ETSI issue is already covered by CVE-2007-6119.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2007-6439 wireshark IPv6 and USB dissector crash
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The WiMAX dissector in Wireshark (formerly Ethereal) 0.99.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via unknown vectors related to "unaligned access on some platforms."
notes.title: Vulnerability description
